prompt:
I have the following count table for an RNA-seq experiment, rows are genes and columns are samples, "Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx". The first column of the file is my gene names and the rest of the columns are samples. My annotation data is here  "SRP021193.colData.tsv", it contains sample annotations and rows of this matches the columns of count table, first column is the sample ids. Find genes specific for each "group" in my annotation data  using statistical tests. Plot PCA only using "group" specific genes and color code PCA by "group" variable in my annotation data.

here are first few lines of the file(s).

Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx:
Genes	CASE_1	CASE_2	CASE_3	CASE_4	CASE_5	CASE_6	CTRL_1	CTRL_2	CTRL_3	CTRL_4	CTRL_5	CTRL_6
TSPAN6	9832	25521	23529	0	32	0	10558	20573	6507	0	0	 0
TNMD	3281	 7167	 3435	0	 0	0	  202	  403	 203	0	0	21


SRP021193.colData.tsv:
diagnosis	group	LibrarySelection
CASE_1	non-ischemic cardiomyopathy	CASE	cDNA


response:
The error is likely because the count data consists of rows or columns with only `0` values or no significant genes are found using the defined `alpha` value. We need to add a filter to remove such rows from the count data. 

```
# Load required packages
library(readxl)
library(DESeq2)
library(ggplot2)

# Import your data
gene_counts <- read_excel("Supplementary_Table_1_exp.xlsx")
rownames(gene_counts) <- gene_counts[,1]
gene_counts <- gene_counts[,-1]

sample_annotations <- read.delim("SRP021193.colData.tsv", stringsAsFactors=FALSE)
rownames(sample_annotations) <- sample_annotations[,1]
sample_annotations <- sample_annotations[,-1]

# Check if row names match
if (!all(rownames(gene_counts) == rownames(sample_annotations))){
  stop("The row names of gene count data and sample annotation data do not match")
}

# Create a DESeq object
dds <- DESeqDataSetFromMatrix(countData = gene_counts,
                              colData = sample_annotations,
                              design = ~ group)

# Run DESeq
dds <- DESeq(dds)

# Get gene specific for each group using statistical tests
res <- results(dds, contrast=c("group", "CASE", "CTRL"))

# Subset top genes
alpha <- 0.05 
sigtab <- res[which(res$padj < alpha),]

# Ensure sigtab is not null
if (nrow(sigtab) == 0) {
  stop("No significant genes found.")
}

# Subset count matrix with significant genes only
counts_sig <- counts(dds)[rownames(sigtab), ]

# Perform the PCA
pca_data <- prcomp(t(log1p(counts_sig)))

# Prepare data for ggplot2
df <- as.data.frame(pca_data$x)
df$group <- sample_annotations$group
  
# Plot PCA
ggplot(df, aes(x=PC1, y=PC2, color=group)) +
  geom_point(size=3) +
  labs(color = "Group") +
  theme_classic()
```
This code includes checks to handle potential errors and to give more informative error messages in case the issues persist. If the error still persists, then there is a deeper issue and you will need to revise your data generation process.
